result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly (nmi) Braun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Kelly Braun to 10 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 8 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH.  

01/17/17: The Court orders the COC to prepare an amended JOC
---The prison term is to remain 10 years structured as: 7 years and 6 months Initial Confinement and 2 years and 6 months Extended Supervision

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $11,329.09 in favor of Richard Carlson

Per Standing Order defendant to pay 10% restitution processing fee

Pursuant to Wis. Stats. 303.01(8), and to facilitate the rehabilitative objective of sentencing, the Department of Corrections shall deduct 25% from inmate wages to pay restitution as ordered by the court.

** Per 2/20/18 Court Order JOC to be amended to eliminate the $11,329.99 in restitution.**

--all other conditions of supervision are at the discretion of DOC

The Court does not order a DNA sample

Arresting Agency: Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes:

[MK] On this date Reserve Judge Moroney, presiding for Branch II, made Findings and Orders that involved this case (however this case was not called during the Hearing). 
The copied/pasted minutes from that Hearing are below:  
cases #01CF186, #01CF188, #01CF190, #01CF345, #01CF346, #01CF347, #01CF350 are called briefly at 9:35am, and then at 9:51am.
Defendant Kelly Braun in court, in custody.  ADA Monica Hall appears in court for the State of Wisconsin, along with DOC Agent Theresa Rauch.  
This hearing is scheduled in regard to Mr. Braun's 6/4/19 letter regarding calculation of the service of sentences.
ADA Hall submits a packet of DOC documents regarding calculations of the sentences and sentence-credits.  
recess 10:01am (for the parties to review the DOC documents), reconvene 10:13am.
___________________
ADA Hall summarizes that when Mr. Braun was released from prison on his 2014 case [14CF317] on 11/20/18, Mr. Braun had 3 years, 2 months, and 16 days to serve either by E.S. or for revocation on the 2001 cases.
Arguments are given by ADA Hall and by Mr. Braun.
___________________
The Court Finds and Orders: 
---on the 2001 cases [the case numbers that the Court called at this hearing] Mr. Braun's terms will end on 2/8/2022.
---on the 2004 case [#04CF444] Mr. Braun's term will end on 2/9/2023.
---on the 2014 case [#14CF317] the consecutive three years will start to run on 2/9/2023, so therefore the term will end on 2/9/2026.
recess 10:29am. 
[Post Hearing: in response to the clerk's inquiry, the Court clarifies that no amendment of the JOC or other action needs to be taken by the clerk in relation of the outcome of this hearing.]
from Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[Resentencing Hearing]

[MA]Case called at 3:22pm 
Defendant Kelly (nmi) Braun in court, custody with Attorney Steven Luchsinger.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court verifies review of PSI, Victim Impact Statement, and Transcripts from initial time of sentencing to today
The Court previously determined that it was appropriate that Mr. Braun be brought back before the Court for re-sentencing

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

ADA Hall indicates that victims are no longer requesting that Mr. Braun pay restitution, and parties have stipulated that Mr. Braun to no longer required to pay restitution

Statement made by Mr. Braun

The Court sentences Mr. Braun to serve 6 years Imprisonment, consisting of 3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision, consecutive to any sentence in being. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

All conditions of extended supervision to remain the same, except restitution, the Court is eliminating the requirement of payment of restitution from Mr. Braun--Mr. Braun is no longer required to pay restitution to the victim 

The Court gives 1,023 days credit.

recess: 3:34pm

[MK] case called at 9:38am. 
Defendant Kelly Braun appears via videoconferencing from the Dodge Correctional Institution, in custody.   ADA Monica Hall appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
This hearing is scheduled on Mr. Braun's 5/2/18 letter.
The Court is able to hear Mr. Braun and to see him on the courtroom monitors, however Mr. Braun is only able hear the Court-- the videoconferencing cameras in the courtroom are currently malfunctioning. 
The Court cannot find the video conferencing system sight-sufficient. The Court proceeds with this hearing as a telephone-type appearance by Mr. Braun.

ADA Hall and Mr. Braun make statements. 
After a discussion with the parties the Court refers Mr. Braun to contact the Jefferson County Public Defenders office to seek representation on this "sentencing denovo request".  The appointed attorney would file a postconviction motion on Mr. Braun's behalf to seek resentencing as a result of an illegal first sentence and Mr. Braun not being present in court for the resentencing that Judge Wambach ordered. 
The Court indicates that if Mr. Braun encounters problems with applying with the Jefferson County PD, then he should write the Court to make the Court aware of this..  
The Court clarifies that it is not scheduling the matter further at this point. The Court will await either a "sentencing denovo request", or some other type of post-conviction motion to be filed. 
recess 9:50am.
Status conference on May 29, 2018 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 1:30pm [ma]
Defendant Kelly (nmi) Braun appears via video conferencing from Dodge Correctional, in custody. His Counsel, Attorney Anthony John Jurek appears in court.  
Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  
The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Upon inquiry of the Court, Atty. Jurek indicates that he did receive the Court's 8/2/16 Order
Upon further inquiry of the Court, Atty. Jurek indicates that he did not correspond with the Court's JA to schedule a Resentencing hearing
The Court finds that It did not set a deadline for the completion of the 8/2/16 Order
The Court finds that Atty. Jurek did receive notice for todays hearing, which included language re: the purpose of todays hearing
The Court finds that Atty. Jurek has not called the Court's JA to schedule the Resentencing hearing since receipt of the notice of hearing 
The Court concludes that Atty Jurek has not complied with the Court's order.
The Court believes a sanction is appropriate
The Court sanctions Atty. Jurek $100 to be paid within 30 days; to be deposited into the County's General Fund 

On DOC 7/11/16 Letter:
--State agrees with DOC letter 
--the Court concludes the 7.5 years is the maximum
--the Court orders the COC to prepare an amended JOC
---The prison term is to remain 10 years structured as: 7 years and 6 months Initial Confinement and 2 years and 6 months Extended Supervision

recess: 1:57pm
Hearing on January 17, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

A resentencing is to be set. Writ to be prepared for Defendant's appearance - Judge Wambach

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:33am [mo]
Defendant Kelly (nmi) Braun in court, in custody with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.


The Court verifies receipt of: Test Report, Social Services Chronological History, and Certificate of Completion submitted by Atty. Luchsinger
--ADA Hall verifies receipt and review
--The Court directs this to be marked as Defendant's Sentencing exhibit; this exhibit is offered and received

Parties verify receipt of PSI; no correction or additions to be made at this time

ADA Monica Hall verifies victim rights compliance; notes victims brother is present in courtroom gallery
Atty. Luchsinger indicates that victim's significant other is present also

ADA Hall submits Victim Impact Statement and Restitution request
--the Court reviews documents
--Atty. Luchsinger indicates that there is no dispute to the amount of restitution at this time

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--Statement made by victims brother, Steven Carlson
--Statement made by Kelly Braun

The Court makes findings as to the PSI

The Court finds that the restitution is appropriate 
The Court finds that Richard Carlson is due  $11,329.09
The Court concludes that Mr. Braun has the ability to pay 

The Court sentences Kelly Braun  to  10  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  8  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH.  

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is  NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives  129   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to pay restitution in the amount of $11,329.09 in favor of Richard Carlson
--to pay statutory costs 
--all other conditions of supervision are at the discretion of DOC

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

The Court does not order a DNA sample

Case called at 3:03pm [mo]
[Scheduled for Plea & Sentencing]
Defendant Kelly (nmi) Braun in court, in custody with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
ADA Hall indicates that Defense counsel recently notified the State that this hearing would be a Plea Hearing only. 

ADA Hall files an Amended Information; gives arguments in support of Court accepting
--The Court grants the State leave to file the Amended Information

Atty. Luchsinger verifies receipt of the Amended Information
--The Court recites the charge and maximum penalties of the charge in the Amended Information

ADA Hall raises to the Court that the subsection of the statute in the Amended Information is incorrect; will prepare a Second Amended Information and present to the Court.
recess:3:12pm--reconvene: 3:14pm

Atty. Luchsinger verifies receipt of the Second Amended Information
--The Court recites the charge and the maximum penalties of the charge of the Second Amended Information


Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "  Guilty  " entered on Count #1 of the Second Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Braun guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court orders that a Pre-Sentence Investigation be conducted.
The Clerk prepares the Order for Pre-Sentence Investigation for the Court's signature
The Court directs the Clerk to attach the Criminal Complaint and the Second Amended Information.
The Court directs the Department to deliver the report to the Court no later than 1/4/2015. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling 
ADA Hall indicates that Mr. Braun should be at Jefferson County Jail at time of Sentencing; requests that shall Mr. Braun remain at Green Bay Correctional Institute, Defense Counsel to notify the State to allow preparation of a Writ.
The Court revokes Mr. Braun's bail; therefore Mr. Braun will be held without bail until the time of Sentencing. 
recess: 3:52pm

case called at 9:46am. [MK]
Defendant Kelly Braun appears via videoconferencing from the Green Bay Correctional Institution, in custody. His counsel, Attorney Steven Luchsinger, is present in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by the Defense. 
The State requests that a Preliminary Hearing date be scheduled within twenty days. 

The Court requires a $100,000  cash bond, with conditions:
--no discussion of the facts of the case with Karl Braun 
--no possession or consumption of any alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
recess 9:53am. 

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing on 12/8/14 at 8:30am (State to prepare writ)
Initial appearance on November 25, 2014 at 09:45 am.
